content: No main content found

Taste Imperial provides fresh food and drink across Imperial's campuses. They have over 28 outlets, including cafes, restaurants, and a convenience store. They aim to provide great food, excellent customer service, and good value for money, catering to different tastes, customs, and budgets. Their team works hard to provide a high standard of customer service, and visitors can leave feedback. Their internal till point systems are managed by Cosmic, and staff should be aware of the Cosmic Accessibility Statement.

metadata.title: About us
key_points: Taste Imperial provides food and drink across Imperial's campuses
They have over 28 outlets, including cafes, restaurants, and a convenience store
They aim to provide great food, excellent customer service, and good value
They cater to different tastes, customs, and budgets
Their team works hard to provide a high standard of customer service
Visitors can leave feedback
Their internal till point systems are managed by Cosmic

content: The Taste Imperial team is committed to providing excellent customer service, with regular reviews, staff training, and encouraging feedback. The Customer Charter outlines their commitment and the standards of service customers can expect, how to obtain information, and how customers can provide feedback to maintain high service standards. The charter applies to all customers, internal or external. Catering staff are committed to providing professional, cheerful, and efficient service, offering the best value, and continuously improving services based on customer feedback. Customers can log complaints via email or an online form, and the team will investigate and respond promptly. Feedback is valued, and improvements are made as necessary. The team aims to provide prompt and helpful telephone, face-to-face, and written communication, and expects customers to treat staff politely and provide feedback to improve services.

metadata.title: Customer charter
key_points: Commitment to excellent customer service
Standards of service outlined in Customer Charter
Catering staff provide professional, efficient service
Feedback and complaints handled promptly
Expectations for customer behavior and communication

content: Imperial College London is committed to sustainability, including reducing beef consumption, serving sustainable fish, providing free non-dairy milk options, and sourcing local, seasonal produce. The Sustainable Food & Drink Policy, developed in 2022, guides these efforts. The college has previously implemented initiatives like using wooden cutlery and removing single-use plastic water cups. Ongoing updates and new sustainability efforts are communicated to the community.

metadata.title: Sustainability
key_points: Reducing beef consumption by 35% annually and eliminating it by 2026
Serving only sustainable, MSC-certified fish
Providing free non-dairy milk options across campus
Stocking local, seasonal produce to reduce food miles
Previous sustainability initiatives like wooden cutlery and removal of single-use plastic water cups

content: Imperial College has announced plans to replace beef with wild culled venison in its menus by 2025-26 due to the high carbon footprint of beef production. Venison has a significantly lower carbon footprint, emitting only 27% of the CO2 emissions of beef. Culling wild deer is also necessary to conserve the health and biodiversity of British countryside and woodlands, as their population has grown problematically high. Venison is a healthy alternative to beef, being higher in protein and vitamins while lower in fat. The college is excited for students to try venison in various dishes.

metadata.title: Our move to venison
key_points: Replacing beef with wild culled venison to reduce carbon footprint
Venison has 27% of the CO2 emissions of beef
Culling deer necessary to conserve British countryside and woodlands
Venison is a healthier alternative to beef
College is introducing venison in various dishes

content: The Taste Imperial Team have won 5 awards at this year's TUCO competition, in a fierce battle of almost 100 competitors. Kitti Szabados took home the Silver Trophy in the Barista Skills challenge and won the Best Speciality Drink award for 'Miss Homemade'. Bianca Ilona-Ciobanu secured the Bronze Trophy in the Mixology Challenge and the Best Signature Cocktail award. Chef Newton Dias won the Silver Trophy in the Best Burger Challenge for his tandoori chicken thigh burger.

metadata.title: Taste win big at Tuco
key_points: Taste Imperial Team won 5 awards at TUCO competition
Kitti Szabados won Barista Skills and Best Speciality Drink
Bianca Ilona-Ciobanu won Mixology Challenge and Best Signature Cocktail
Newton Dias won Best Burger Challenge

content: Imperial College London operates 29 food and drink outlets across its campuses, offering a wide variety of options and cuisines. The South Kensington campus has 17 outlets, including the Business School Cafe, Chemistry Cafe, College Cafe, Eastside Bar and Restaurant, Electrical Engineering Cafe, Essentials Convenience Store, h-bar, JCR Deli, Kimiko, and The Bakery. The Charing Cross, Hammersmith, and White City campuses also have on-site cafes and restaurants, such as Reynolds Cafe, Wolfson Restaurant, Ex Libris Cafe, MRC Cafe, The Invention Rooms Cafe, and The MSRH Cafe.

metadata.title: Catering outlets
key_points: Imperial College London operates 29 food and drink outlets across its campuses
The South Kensington campus has 17 outlets with a wide variety of options and cuisines
Other campuses also have on-site cafes and restaurants
Outlets include cafes, bars, convenience stores, and restaurants

content: The Business School Café is open Monday to Friday, 8.30 to 17.30, and offers a selection of hot and cold dishes, baguettes, pastries, and hot beverages. It is conveniently located at the ground floor of the Business School Building, next to Imperial's main entrance on Exhibition Road.

metadata.title: Business School Café
key_points: The Business School Café is open Monday to Friday, 8.30 to 17.30
It offers a selection of hot and cold dishes, baguettes, pastries, and hot beverages
The café is conveniently located at the ground floor of the Business School Building, next to Imperial's main entrance on Exhibition Road

content: The Chemistry Café offers a great view, serving jacket potatoes, baguettes, panini, and hot/cold drinks. There are desktop computers and a comfortable seating area. The café is located in the Chemistry Building's Common Room, and you'll need your College ID to access the building.

metadata.title: Chemistry Café
metadata.location: Chemistry Building's Common Room, South Kensington campus

content: College Café offers a wide range of hot and cold options for breakfast, lunch, and everything in between. It is open Monday to Friday, from 8.00 to 18.00, and is located next to the Alumni Centre near the main entrance. The café serves freshly prepared bacon sandwiches, toasties, filled croissants, breakfast yoghurt, and porridge with toppings. For lunch, there are delicious hand-carved roast sandwiches with homemade dressings. The café also has a juice bar where you can order healthy juice concoctions and smoothies.

metadata.title: College Café
metadata.location: Next to the Alumni Visitor Centre in the College's main entrance
menu_items: Freshly prepared bacon sandwiches, toasties, filled croissants
Breakfast yoghurt and porridge with toppings
Delicious hand-carved roast sandwiches with homemade dressings

content: Eastside Restaurant and Bar is a lively, contemporary eaterie where you can enjoy a selection of drinks and excellent food ranging from healthy salads to delicious main meals. It also has bar snacks and sports fixtures on large plasma screens, making it a great place to socialize with friends and colleagues. Eastside is a membership-only bar that welcomes staff, students, and alumni from Imperial, as well as 'Friends of Imperial' like local residents and museum employees. Guests can also be brought in, but they will need to sign in.

metadata.title: Eastside Restaurant and Bar
metadata.location: Eastside is situated on the ground floor of Linstead Hall and is part of Eastside halls of residence in Prince's Gardens.
facilities: Selection of drinks and excellent food
Healthy salads and delicious main meals
Sports fixtures on large plasma screens

membership.requirements: Eastside is a membership-only bar that welcomes staff, students, and alumni from Imperial, as well as 'Friends of Imperial' like local residents and museum employees
membership.guest_policy: Guests can also be brought in, but they will need to sign in

content: Essentials Convenience Store is Imperial's on-campus store that stocks daily essentials, including organic and fair trade products, world foods, toiletries, household items, beverages, newspapers, and more. The store is located in the Eastside Halls of Residence and is open Monday to Friday from 8:00 to 21:00, and Saturday & Sunday from 10:00 to 16:30. The store also has 24-hour accessible vending machines and an ATM machine.

metadata.title: Essentials Convenience Store
key_points: On-campus convenience store
Stocks daily essentials, including organic and fair trade products
Located in Eastside Halls of Residence
Open 7 days a week with extended hours
Has 24-hour accessible vending machines and ATM

content: The Ex Libris Cafe is open Monday to Friday, from 10.30 to 17.30 and offers a wide range of hot and cold snacks, including a daily 'grab and go' selection of panini, Phat pies, pasties, salads, baguettes, and barista coffee. The cafe is located on the first floor of the Commonwealth Building in the Hammersmith Campus.

key_points: Ex Libris Cafe is open Monday to Friday, 10.30 to 17.30

content: The Huxley Café is located in the Huxley Building at 180 Queen's Gate. It is open Monday to Friday, from 9.00 to 15.30, and serves a selection of grab and go items and hot drinks.

metadata.title: Huxley Café

content: Kimiko serves sushi and hot Japanese food, all of which is made fresh on site each day! From Katsu curry to teriyaki salmon the menu is packed with popular options, plus with an extensive selection of Asian drinks and snacks available, it's a really exciting place to eat. Kimiko is located in the Junior Common Room on Level 2 of the Sherfield Building.

key_points: Serves fresh sushi and hot Japanese food

It is divided into a café and bar section. h-bar serves a selection of food from Kokoro, including sushi and hot bento boxes. content: The Library Café is a great choice for meals and study spots on campus. It's open extended hours and offers a variety of food and drink options, from breakfast to late night. Located on the ground floor of the library building, the café features comfortable seating and PC access.

key_points: Open extended hours: Monday-Friday 8am-10pm, Saturday-Sunday 10am-4pm

content: Lumen Café is open Monday to Friday, from 11.00 to 19.00, with access to outside seating on Dalby Court. It's a popular spot for staff and students, offering a great place to have a meeting, business or social, over a cup of coffee made by experienced baristas. The café also serves a variety of cakes, panini, pastries, muffins, sandwiches, and bagels. The Lumen Café is located in the Foyer area of the Electrical Engineering Building on the South Kensington Campus.

content: The MRC Cafe serves a range of food and drinks, including pastries, baguettes, panini, ciabattas, snacks, and hot and cold beverages. It's open Monday to Friday from 8:30 to 15:30 and is a great place to take a break and socialize.

content: Home Administration and support services Food and drink Catering outlets MSRH Café The MSRH Café is located in the Molecular Science Research Hub at the new White City Campus. This modern space is perfect for relaxing with a hot drink or sandwich. The café serves sandwiches, snacks, and barista-style coffee. It's a great place to socialize with colleagues or catch up on work.

Home Administration and support services Food and drink Catering outlets Neo Pizza & Pasta Opening Hours Neo Pizza & Pasta is open Monday to Friday, from 11.30 to 14.30. Location Neo Pizza and Pasta can be found in the JCR.

content: Plantworks is Imperial College's first entirely plant-based and vegan catering outlet. It features a bespoke and fresh menu of plant-based hot foods and drinks every day. If you're looking for a healthier option or want to make your diet more sustainable, Plantworks provides a contemporary and fresh spin to the range of food available on campus. Plantworks is located in the Junior Common Room (JCR) and is open Monday to Friday, from 11.30 to 14.30.

Located in the Junior Common Room (JCR), open Monday to Friday, 11.30 to 14.30

content: The Queen's Tower Rooms offers international food court style dining and serves cuisine from around the globe. It has two course meal deals that provide good value, making it a popular option for staff and students. Customers can choose from Traditional, Roast, Copper Pot or Wok meal deals, which include sides, soup, roll, dessert, and a drink. The QTR will be closed during exam periods in March and April-June 2023. The Queen's Tower Restaurant is located on Level 1 of the Sherfield Building on the South Kensington Campus.

key_points: Offers international food court style dining

The RCM Student Bar is open Monday & Tuesday, from 17.00 to 22.30 and Wednesday to Friday, from 17.00 to 22.30. The RCM Restaurant is open to Imperial staff and students and offers a range of hot and cold snacks and beverages. A full lunch menu is also available between 12.00 and 14.00. Location RCM Restaurant is located in the Royal College of Music on Prince Consort Road. For more information, please visit the Royal College of Music food and drink webpages.

content: Reynolds Café is open Monday to Friday, from 8.30 to 20.00. It serves a selection of sandwiches, snacks, ciabattas, salads, beverages, cold drinks, plus a variety of confectionery and chocolates. The Snack Bar is the ideal place to relax or have a meeting with your colleagues during the day. They also serve English breakfasts, barista coffee and pastries, and you can enjoy a yoghurt bar too.

content: The Bakery is a new catering outlet at Imperial College London's South Kensington campus, offering a range of freshly-baked pastries, slices, baguettes, cakes, doughnuts, and hot breakfast options. It also houses the university's first Starbucks cafe, providing a variety of drinks and beverages.

metadata.title: The Bakery
metadata.location: The Bakery is located in the Junior Common Room on South Kensington campus.

content: Home Administration and support services Food and drink Catering outlets The Foundry The Foundry Opening hours The Foundry is open Thursday and Friday from 16.00 to 23.00. Welcome to The Foundry, the College's own pub in North Acton, available to our students, staff and neighbours. Serving a delicious array of pub favourite beers, wines and spirits, it's the perfect spot if you're looking to unwind. We're located right in the heart of the Imperial community in North Acton, just next to Woodward Buildings and across the street from Kemp Porter Buildings. No booking required but, if you'd like to explore using our space for a large event, you can reach us at foundrybookings@imperial.ac.uk

content: The Loud Bird is a catering outlet on the ground floor of the Sir Alexander Fleming Building. It is open Monday to Friday from 8:00 to 16:00 and offers a selection of grilled chicken, burgers, wraps, vegan options, sides, and signature sauces. The outlet also serves hot coffee and tea all day in partnership with 'Roastology'.

content: The Pantry is a new pop-up concept that offers everyday essentials at low, wholesale prices. It is open Monday to Friday, 11.00 to 14.00, and is available at Sherfield Walkway and Wolfson Restaurant in Hammersmith. The Pantry focuses on food staples that can be purchased wholesale and passed on to the community at significantly reduced prices, such as rice, pasta, cereals, and vegetables. Customers can pick up pre-packed grab bags or weigh out their own produce. The Pantry is operated on a not-for-profit basis.

metadata.title: The Pantry
key_points: The Pantry offers everyday essentials at low, wholesale prices
It is open Monday to Friday, 11.00 to 14.00, at Sherfield Walkway and Wolfson Restaurant

content: The Roastery is a modern cafe located in the Senior Common Room, offering a range of hot breakfast and lunch options, sandwiches, snacks, and handmade drinks. It features an exclusive Imperial Coffee blend sourced from Brazilian and Nicaraguan medium-roast beans, providing a more balanced, lighter taste.

metadata.title: The Roastery
metadata.location: Sherfield Building, Senior Common Room level 2

content: The Works is a contemporary eatery that serves the White City Campus from breakfast until late, with a wide-ranging menu including gluten-free, vegetarian and vegan options as well as daily lunch specials from around the world. It reflects the industrial heritage of the building's namesake, Sir Michael Uren, and offers a multi-use space that shifts from a cafe to a restaurant to a venue.

metadata.title: The Works
menu_highlights: World foods options (e.g., Teriyaki noodles, Java squash curry, Miso and sesame roasted aubergines)

content: Wolfson Restaurant offers a variety of hot and cold lunch options, including jacket potatoes, salads, and a deli bar for custom baguettes. It is located on the ground floor of the Wolfson Conference Centre at the Hammersmith Campus.

content: The new Dill app allows you to pre-order, pre-pay, and pick up food from various catering outlets on campus. To use Dill, you need to download the app, register with your Imperial email, choose your desired outlet and menu items, and pre-pay before picking up your order at the designated time. Currently, Dill is available at The College Cafe, Eastside, SCR, The Bakery, and Wolfson.

metadata.title: Dill
key_points: Pre-order and pre-pay for food using the Dill app
Choose from various catering outlets on campus
Pick up your order at the designated time
Dill is currently available at 5 outlets

content: The MI Cup Initiative is a new reusable cup scheme at Imperial College London to reduce the use of disposable cups across campus. Customers can purchase a MI Cup for £5 and receive a free drink. The MI Cup is environmentally-friendly, as it reduces the use of disposable cups and stops single-use plastic cups from going to landfill. The initiative aims to promote sustainable solutions and generate a positive impact for the environment.

metadata.title: MI Cup Initiative
key_points: New reusable cup scheme at Imperial College London
Customers can purchase a MI Cup for £5 and get a free drink
MI Cup is environmentally-friendly, reducing disposable cup waste
Initiative promotes sustainable solutions and environmental impact

content: Yoyo Wallet is working with Imperial to make campus payments easier, faster, and more rewarding. The Yoyo app allows you to pay for goods and earn points on every purchase. You'll get digital loyalty cards and receipts, and can reach out to the support team with any questions.

metadata.title: Yoyo
key_points: Yoyo Wallet partners with Imperial for campus payments
Easy, fast payments with QR code scanning
Earn points on every purchase to redeem rewards
Digital loyalty cards and receipts, no paper
Support team available for any queries or concerns
